title: Lucian needs to be nerfed - even after 4.18
body:
I just find it somewhat humorous that no other champ comes to my mind who's weakness is being too strong.  The only way I have found to beat Lucian is not mechanical or items, but that the Lucian has to be somewhat stupid, and you have to catch him doing something stupid.

That being said, Lucians get away with doing stupid things very often, and it is merely the properties of the champ that saves them, not individual skill or knowledge of the game.  I mean just getting a flash out of the guy is a victory in itself.

Lucian is so strong that, when he is played, there is just a complete dominance of the lane.  If you are a superior player, you can still easily get screwed over by his insane burst.  However, when you have the advantage and attempt to use it, he simply dashes away.

There is no beating a good Lucian in lane.  I, myself play Lucian quite often and I am constantly calling BS with most of my OP maneuvers.  I literally feel bad for the other adc.  The skill level to play Lucian is so low, yet he has so much mobility and can make plays very easily.  I mean, there is such a skill gap in my mind between a good Vayne, for example, and a good Lucian.  Vayne requires so much more practice and skill than the champion that simply dashes to you, autos, Q's, autos,  and by this time, over half of your HP is likely gone, and you've only been able to reply with maybe 1/4 of his health.

I have played countless games against, and as, Lucian.  Many of which as his hardest "counter", Vayne.  There is no counter to this guy, he is BS.

Either he needs to be nerfed, or virtually all other Marksmen need to be buffed in order to keep up with this new game.

EDIT: For a nerf, I would suggest a slightly longer reaction time for his Q (even with 90 ping, it is nearly impossible to dodge), that his passive does not crit, and even perhaps that relentless pursuit does not go through walls (this guy escapes too well).  If you can't do the last one, at least buff Vayne to be able to tumble through walls...

So, they tried to fix that by reducing his range, and giving him a lot of extra buffs to compensate.  His burst was still insane.  So they reverted some of those buffs, but they still didn't touch his damage.

Ezreal, unlike Lucian, is also mostly single target, with bad waveclear.

What they could do with Lucian is to have Q deal half damage to minions and remove the 4x damage to minions multiplier from R.

Both of those are problems, as are his mobility, range, and just about everything else about him. 

We know Rito wants to make him the mobility ADC, so we can cut that. But honestly, he shouldn't be able to spam his skills, do more damage than anything else on the rift, hit you from outside your turret... Each of those would be fine on its own... I'd be fine with him having (very) low damage, high mobility, and a range like Twitch's ult, or high damage, high mobility, and no range with long cooldowns or high mana costs... make it harder for him to bully the crap out of you.

Lucian was left unbanned very few times during Worlds so far, and every time he resulted in a snowball for his team. At the pro level, that shouldn't be possible.

No champ has very low damage, every champ has viable damage, as it should be.
His range is on the lower half of ADC, though not the lowest by far.
His damage is good, not the highest, but certainly still good.  
His mobility is very reliant upon his combo, without which, he would have less mobility than Teemo.
His cool downs are decent, 9/14/18 at rank one each.
His mana looks to be the only place where he's been given some space to really breath.  At lvl 3 he can get off two full combos before needing to wait for his mana to regen.  This isn't atypical, but it's on the more forgiving side.  Many champs can pull off something like that, a few though have more demanding mana costs, but not by much.
I suppose it's feasible he could handle a minor cost increase, but I'm not about to go jumping to any conclusions.

Believe it or not, his general weakness is actually a lack of damage. Literally, his ONLY steroid is his passive. Caitlyn is the only other adc with this kind of mechanic, and is known for having ridiculously low overall damage output compared to other carries, in exchange for her other strengths such as range. 

Lucian's passive is a lot more straight power than Caitlyn's, though, as it can be used multiple times easily, and he has an auto attack reset. His e is barely an auto reset though, and can start delaying your auto attack if your attack speed gets around 2.0. His general disadvantage, I will say again, comes from the fact that every other adc in the game has some form of steroid or range advantage over him, sometimes both. He also lacks a disengage, packing only one escape, where his most often compared character, Vayne, has an escape, a stealth, and a disengage. She also has two of the better steroids in the game, +70 ad and silver bolts are nothing to scoff at, where tumble eventually becomes a better, while shorter range, version of Lucian's e in sheer stats. 

How do you beat Lucian, then? The answer is to not lose. He is a lane bully, don't try to beat him in lane, let him make a mistake, or instead just try to make it to late game. Any adc with a superior steroid will just outright outdamage Lucian if you are similar in gold. Draven, for example, can be down half an item, but because of the sheer steroids on his kit, can kill Lucian first in a duel, and also packs one of the better range disengages in the game, performing similarly to how you would use Thresh's Flay.

All of this is why Tristana is still the most popular adc in high ranked play. While she may have issues early game, being outranged by caitlyn and outdamaged by anyone with a nuke, if she gets to late game, she has an on-demand huge steroid with the best constant basic attack range in the game, allowing her to just deal more damage than every other marksman in the game reliably. She's also packing one of the highest range leaps in the game, arguably the best disengage in the game, and grievous wounds.

Why, then, would you pick Lucian over Tristana? Early game strengths, with still decent late game mobility and not half bad damage output. But almost exclusively early game strengths.

Don't play to win, play to not lose.
